channel.title: BIOS2 Education resources
channel.description: Educational materials, incluing links to pdfs, videos, and code to reproduce all of our trainings.

item.title: Spatial Statistics in Ecology, Part 4
item.dc:creator: Philippe Marchand
item.description: Introduction to spatial statistics offered by Philippe Marchand to BIOS2 Fellows in January 2021. In the previous parts, we saw how to account for spatial dependence in linear regression models with either geostatistical models (also called Gaussian processes) or spatial autocorrelation models (CAR/SAR). In this last part, we will see how to combine these features with more complex regression models, in particular generalized linear mixed models (GLMM).

item.title: Spatial Statistics in Ecology, Part 3
item.dc:creator: Philippe Marchand
item.description: Third part of the introduction to spatial statistics offered by Philippe Marchand to BIOS2 Fellows in January 2021, focused on aerial data analysis in R.

item.title: Spatial Statistics in Ecology, Part 2
item.dc:creator: Philippe Marchand
item.description: Introduction to spatial statistics offered by Philippe Marchand to BIOS2 Fellows in January 2021. This second part is focused on spatial correlations and geostatistical models.

item.title: Statistiques spatiales en écologie, Partie 2
item.dc:creator: Philippe Marchand
item.description: Cours de introduction aux statistiques spatiales offert par Philippe Marchand aux boursiers BIOS2 en janvier 2021. Cette deuxième partie est axée sur les corrélations spatiales et les modèles géostatistiques.

item.title: Spatial Statistics in Ecology, Part 1
item.dc:creator: Philippe Marchand
item.description: Introduction to spatial statistics offered by Philippe Marchand to BIOS2 Fellows in January 2021. This first part focuses on concepts and initial analyses.

item.title: Statistiques spatiales en écologie, Partie 1
item.dc:creator: Philippe Marchand
item.description: Cours de introduction aux statistiques spatiales offert par Philippe Marchand aux boursiers BIOS2 en janvier 2021. Cette première partie se concentre sur les concepts et les premières analyses.
